issue.title: [C++] Add null_if kernel
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-17090](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-17090). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Add a binary kernel `null_if(x, y)` that returns `null` if `x` equals `y` , otherwise returns `x`.

This function is commonly found in many databases and query engines and is typically named `nullif`. For example: [PostgreSQL](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/15/functions-conditional.html#FUNCTIONS-NULLIF), [Impala](https://impala.apache.org/docs/build/html/topics/impala_conditional_functions.html#conditional_functions__nullif), [Snowflake](https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/functions/nullif.html).
